keyword: how many calories in a bottle of red wine 750ml
title: How Many Calories in a 750ml Bottle of Red Wine?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a bottle of red wine 750ml, including carbs, alcohol impact, per-100ml breakdown, and variations for different types.
h1: How Many Calories in a 750ml Bottle of Red Wine?
assumptions: Dry red table wine, ~12.5% ABV, standard serving; calories primarily from alcohol and residual sugars.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, sweetness, alcohol content, brand, and vintage. Check bottle labels for precise values.

quick_answer.text: A 750ml bottle of dry red wine has about 638 calories, mostly from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Semi-sweet red wine (added sugars) per 100 ml
Lower ABV light red wine (11%) per 100 ml

faqs.q: How many calories in a bottle of red wine 750ml?
faqs.a: Approximately 638 calories for a standard dry red wine.
Yes, about 19.5 g total carbs in 750 ml, mainly from residual sugars.

faqs.q: Are there fats or protein in red wine?
faqs.a: Negligible: 0 g fat and ~0.8 g protein per 750 ml bottle.

faqs.q: How does wine alcohol affect calories?
faqs.a: Alcohol contributes ~7 kcal per gram; higher ABV increases total calories.

faqs.q: What about calories in white wine vs. red?
faqs.a: Similar, around 600-650 kcal per 750 ml bottle, depending on type and sweetness.
